meanings.definition: To prepare or make ready in advance.
meanings.sent1: She prepaved the ingredients for the cake before starting to bake.
meanings.sent2: The workers prepaved the road before the busy traffic hours.
meanings.sent3: He always prepaved his excuses for being late to work, but his boss never believed him.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous planning prepaved the way for a successful event.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prepaved the lesson to ensure all students understood the material.

meanings.definition: Prepared or made ready in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prepaved picnic basket was filled with delicious treats.
meanings.sent2: The prepaved schedule allowed for a smooth workflow throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The prepaved camping gear made the trip much more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her prepaved speech was well-received by the audience.
meanings.sent5: The prepaved path through the forest made hiking much easier.
